page.title: 11LEISURE : QUINTON
page.content: {Amenities and facilities}for the villagers of Quinton are a continuing {subject for debate. For the very{young children}in army quarters, or on the council estates, there is some open{space,}with slides, swings etc. There is the {village green in Upper Quinton. For adults, there are{two}pubs. Many people{walk}locally, especially up Meon Hill.The{village hall}has some programme of events, but this does not seem to cater for everybody. For the{youth,}the old village school is used as a{club.}However, for most amenities,locals have to travel to{Stratford. {Facilities on the army base}can be used by service families, but civilians have very limited access. The village shops provide good,basic requirements. A library van calls.
